description: Airtable merges spreadsheet functionality with database power, enabling teams to organize projects, track tasks, and collaborate through customizable views, automation, and integrations for data management

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_BASE
capabilities.description: Creates a new Airtable base with specified tables and fields within a workspace.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a new comment on a specific record within an Airtable base and table.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_FIELD
capabilities.description: Creates a new field within a specified table in an Airtable base.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_MULTIPLE_RECORDS
capabilities.description: Creates multiple new records in a specified Airtable table.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_RECORD
capabilities.description: Creates a new record in a specified Airtable table; field values must conform to the table's column types.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_TABLE
capabilities.description: Creates a new table within a specified existing Airtable base, allowing definition of its name, description, and field structure.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_DELETE_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Deletes an existing comment from a specified record in an Airtable table.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_DELETE_MULTIPLE_RECORDS
capabilities.description: Deletes up to 10 specified records from a table within an Airtable base.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_DELETE_RECORD
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific record from an existing table within an existing Airtable base.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_GET_BASE_SCHEMA
capabilities.description: Retrieves the detailed schema for a specified Airtable base, including its tables, fields, field types, and configurations, using the `baseId`.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_GET_RECORD
capabilities.description: Retrieves a specific record from a table within an Airtable base.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_GET_USER_INFO
capabilities.description: Retrieves information, such as ID and permission scopes, for the currently authenticated Airtable user from the `/meta/whoami` endpoint.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_LIST_BASES
capabilities.description: Retrieves all Airtable bases accessible to the authenticated user, which may include an 'offset' for pagination.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_LIST_COMMENTS
capabilities.description: Retrieves all comments for a specific record in an Airtable table, requiring existing `baseId`, `tableIdOrName`, and `recordId`.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_LIST_RECORDS
capabilities.description: Retrieves records from an Airtable table, with options for filtering, sorting, pagination, and specifying returned fields. Common 422 Errors and Solutions: - INVALID_FILTER_BY_FORMULA: Check field names are case-sensitive and enclosed in {}. Escape single quotes by doubling them (''). - UNKNOWN_FIELD_NAME: Verify field names exist in the table. Use Get Base Schema action to discover correct field names. Best Practices: 1. Always verify field names using Get Base Schema before using them in filters or field lists 2. Test formulas in Airtable's web interface before using them in API calls 3. Use table IDs instead of names when possible for better reliability

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_UPDATE_MULTIPLE_RECORDS
capabilities.description: Updates multiple existing records in a specified Airtable table; these updates are not performed atomically.

capabilities.name: AIRTABLE_UPDATE_RECORD
capabilities.description: Modifies specified fields of an existing record in an Airtable base and table; the base, table, and record must exist.
